alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 1:28PM EDT until May 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Kentucky and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Bracken, Campbell, Grant, Kenton, Owen and Pendleton. In Southwest Ohio, Clermont. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Independence, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Williamstown, Falmouth, Claryville, Crittenden, New Richmond, Dry Ridge, Butler, Neville, Morgan, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Corinth, Mentor, Moscow, California and Chilo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
